2.title: The 90th Academy Awards
2.plot: Festival Road Trip follows short filmmakers anxiously waiting to see if they'll take home the gold at the most iconic film event in history, The Academy Awards. This year, we'll get an inside look into Oscars week by focusing on nominees from the Animation and Documentary short film categories.

3.title: Bangalore International Short Film Festival
3.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Raindance Film Festival
1.plot: Set in London, Raindance Film Festival is one of the most culturally diverse and iconic film festivals in England. Festival Road Trip gives you a behind the scenes look at exclusive interviews and clips from nominated filmmakers and what they are going through as they prepare for awards night. We'll follow Vicki Psarias, filmmaker of Broken, on her journey through the Festival and what it took to get become a nominee for Best British short. Make sure you watch Festival Road Trip to find out if Vicki Psarias goes home with the gold at the Raindance 2008 Film Festival.

2.title: Encounters Film Festival
2.plot: Take an exclusive look into the Encounters Short Film Festival with Festival Road Trip. Located in Bristol, England, this festival is strictly only Short film, and therefore is extremely coveted for all short filmmakers. Watch a rare interview from Mark Cosgrove, the festivals director, and follow on the personal journey of filmmaker Simon Aboud with his short Come Here Today. Watch this episode of Festival Road Trip to take a look inside the strictly shorts festival Encounters Short Film Festival.

3.title: BFI 52nd London Film Festival
3.plot: The Times BFI Film Festival 2008 was the 52nd Festival held in the beloved city of London, England. Festival Road Trip went behind the scenes with clips from the Festival, as well as interviews from the head programmer, Michael Hayden. We will take you on a journey with Destiny Ekaragha, from her inspiration of the film all the way to the festival. Watch to find out what it takes to partake in a festival as big as The Times BFI London Film Festival.

4.title: 62nd Cannes Film Festival
4.plot: Festival Road Trip is at the glamorous Cannes Film Festival 2009, following the nine nominees for the highest prize awarded Palme d'Or Award at the French film festival. Director Jean-Christophe Lies, The Man in the Blue Gordini, Emma Sullivans, After Tomorrow, Joao Salavizas, Arena, Liala Pakaininas Silence, and a few others are interviewed about their films, nerves, hopes, and time at the famous festival. Follow their journey down the 100 yards of star studded and paparazzi filled Red Carpet as one of the nine directors wins the Golden Palm prize.

5.title: 66th Venice International Film Festival
5.plot: One this special edition of Festival Road Trip, filmmaker Jake Price hijacks the show to bring you to the Venice Film Festival, where he is in the process of taping a documentary for Shorts. Unfortunately, he is a little bitter because his short film was not chosen to be in the festival, however, Jake manages to obtain exclusive footage, clips, and interviews with filmmaker Paulo Jose, rabbi turned director Meni Philip. Jake also interviews and questions Stuart Gordon who is the President of the short film jury. Watch this hijacked episode of Festival Road Trip to ...

6.title: Sundance Film Festival
6.plot: One of the most famous festivals in the world, Festival Road Trip gives you an exclusive look into Sundance Film Festival 2009 in Park City Utah. In the segment, we follow recently graduated film maker Olivia Silver and her short Little Canyon. Festival Road Trip takes you behind the scenes of Sundance as we follow Olivias journey with personal interviews of her, as well as her friends and cast members. Take a look into Olivia Silvers journey with her short film Little Canyon as she bares the cold weather at Sundance Film Festival.

7.title: 5th Dubai International Film Festival
7.plot: Festival Road Trip is at the growing Dubai Film Festival located in the heart of the luxurious city of Dubai. For ten days, the festival invites all the up and coming film directors, as well as films. This episode features clips of Dubai and the festival, as well as red carpet interview with Oliver Stone. Festival Road Trip also interviews two of the up and coming short directors who are in the competition for one of the highest prize money offered for any short film. Find out who will win the $60,000 award at the Dubai Film Festival.

8.title: Palm Springs International Film Festival 2009
8.plot: Festival Roadtrip travels the world selecting the best up-and-coming filmmakers with projects in top festivals such as Sundance, Berlin, and Comic-Con and gives us an inside look at their festival experience.

9.title: 49th Krakow Film Festival
9.plot: In the culturally rich city of Krakow Poland, Festival Road Trip is bringing you an insiders look into the respected documentary and short Krakow Film Festival. With interviews from the director of the film festival, as well as an insiders step-by-step look into the festival with Leaving filmmakers Richard Penfold and Sam Hearn. Find out what happens to the fate of Richard and Sams film in this episode of Festival Road Trip Krakow Film Festival.

10.title: 14th LA Shorts Fest/Rushes Soho Shorts Film Festival
10.plot: This episode of Festival Road Trip takes you to two festivals in one episode with the Rushes Soho Shorts Festival in London, England, and the LA Shorts Fest is Los Angelos California. With the help of George Taylor in London, and Bert and Birdie in LA, get a behind the scenes look with clips and interviews from both festivals.

11.title: Comic-Con
11.plot: Festival Roadtrip travels the world selecting the best up-and-coming filmmakers with projects in top festivals such as Sundance, Berlin, and Comic-Con and gives us an inside look at their festival experience.

12.title: Guanajuato International Film Festival
12.plot: Festival Roadtrip travels the world selecting the best up-and-coming filmmakers with projects in top festivals such as Sundance, Berlin, and Comic-Con and gives us an inside look at their festival experience.

13.title: 7th Dubai International Film Festival
13.plot: Festival Road Trip is in the luxurious and ever-growing city of Dubai for the Dubai Film Festival. The ambitious city with the worlds finest hotels as the setting for the festival, Festival Road Trip is talking to those involved in the festival as well as an exclusive interview with director Peter Weir, actor Colin Farrell, and actor Jim Sturgess on the red carpet. Festival Road Trip also exclusive talked to Jean Reno about his return to short films. Also interviewed is up and coming director from the Dubai area, Abdulla AlKaabi, and Pradeepan Raveendran. Watch this ...

14.title: The 83rd Academy Awards
14.plot: Festival Roadtrip travels the world selecting the best up-and-coming filmmakers with projects in top festivals such as Sundance, Berlin, and Comic-Con and gives us an inside look at their festival experience.

15.title: 64th Cannes Film Festival
15.plot: Festival Road Trip is at the glamorous Cannes Film Festival in the south of France, ready to provide you with an insiders look into one of the most prestigious film festivals in the world. Get up close and personal with the finalist film makers in the short categories with exclusive interviews, clips, and behind the scenes look into their journey in the festival. Interviews with Nash Edgerton, Maryna Vroda, and the other finalist. Watch this episode to find out who wins the Palme d'Or.

1.title: Annecy Animation Festival
1.plot: Annecy Animation Film Festival is the second largest film festival in the France, Festival Road Trip Annecy follows three first time competitors on their journey to getting the grand prize. Jody Kramers Dont Tell Santa Youre Jewish, Jacob Stalhammars Night Sounds, and Kirk Hendrys Junk. As well as interviews with Nullarbor directors Alister Lockhart and Patrick Sarrel and La Détente directors Pieree Ducos and Bertrand Bey. Follow their journey thought the beautiful alpine village of Anncy and see who get the coverte Annecy Crystal ...

2.title: LA Shorts Fest
2.plot: Festival Roadtrip travels the world selecting the best up-and-coming filmmakers with projects in top festivals such as Sundance, Berlin, and Comic-Con and gives us an inside look at their festival experience.

4.title: Guanajuato International Film Festival
4.plot: A festival that spans two unique cities, the Mexico Film Festival brings a love of the arts and short movies for 10 days to the people and the audiences. Festival Road Trip follows Vatche Boulghourjian and his short "The Fifth Column", Mitsuyo Miyazaki short "Tsuyako" or "Trailer", and Pedro Gomez Millan and his short film " Piel (The Skin I'm In)". As we journey between the cities with the filmmakers, get an inside scoop on all the inside events that happen during the festival whether it is academic base, career base, screenings, or parties. Watch to find out who ...

5.title: Comic-Con International
5.plot: The International Comic Con 2011 in San Diego California plays host to a week long comic book, film, television, pop culture, and all-around geek celebrated festival. Festival Road Trip explored the many halls of Comic Con, specifically the Comic Con International Independent Film Festival, where we followed James St. Vincent and Zeke Pinheiro filmmakers for their short, The Price, Alexis Villa and his short The Kneaded Head, and filmmakers Rider and Shiloh Strong with their film The Dungeon Master. Watch this episode of Festival Road Trip to see if these shorts used ...

6.title: Heartland Film Festival
6.plot: Festival Roadtrip travels the world selecting the best up-and-coming filmmakers with projects in top festivals such as Sundance, Berlin, and Comic-Con and gives us an inside look at their festival experience.

7.title: The 84th Academy Awards: Live Action
7.plot: The biggest award ceremony in the world, Festival Road Trip has the inside scoop on the Oscars 2012 Live Action Shorts. Get a behind the scenes look with interviews and clips of the directors nominated, as well as an interview with Academy Executive Jon Bloom about what it takes to be nominated for this category. Feel the excitement and take a look inside this huge global event for these Academy Award Nominees.

8.title: The 84th Academy Awards: Animation
8.plot: The biggest award ceremony in the world, Festival Road Trip has the inside scoop on the Oscar 2012 Animated Shorts. Get a behind the scenes look with interviews and clips of the directors and Academy Executives Bill Kroyer about the road to the Oscars. Feel the excitement and take a look inside this huge global event for these Academy Award Nominees.

9.title: The 84th Academy Awards: Documentary
9.plot: The biggest award ceremony in the world, Festival Road Trip has the inside scoop on the Oscars 2012 Documentaries. Get a behind the scenes look with interviews and clips of the directors nominated, as well as an interview with Oscar winner Michael Moore. Feel the excitement and take a look inside this huge global event for these Academy Award Nominees.

11.title: Netherlands Film Festival 2012
11.plot: Festival Road Trip brings you to the beautiful city of Utrecht to the Netherlands Film Festival. Now in its 32nd year, the festival celebrates the best and brightest in film making. With exclusive interviews from the festival directors, and clips of the festival, Festival Road Trip provides a true insiders look into the festival. We also follow filmmakers Bram Schouw, Camile, Jisko Hulsing on their journey through the festival. Learn more about Utrecht, and get a behind the scenes look into the Netherlands Film Festival.

12.title: Leuven Film Festival
12.plot: Festival Road Trip travels to the historic city of Leuvan to go to the International Film Festival of Leuvan. With exclusive footage of the festival, with behind the scenes look of the history and importance the festival has for shorts. Interviews with program creator, filmmaker Roman Klochov, Balder Skanstrom-Bo, and Oscar nominated short Death of a Shadow director Tom van Avermaet. Go inside the Leuvan Film Festival with Festival Road Trip to learn more about this esteemed event.

10.title: LA Femme Film Festival
10.plot: In this edition of Festival Road Trip, we're heading to the home of the movie industry, Los Angeles, to follow the journeys of Mariana and Audi as they compete at LA Femme Film Festival, the event that specifically celebrates the work of women filmmakers.

1.title: The 88th Academy Awards
1.plot: Join us for Festival Road Trip, where we'll be following short filmmakers anxiously waiting to see if they'll take home the gold at the most iconic film event in history, Tha Academy Awards. This year, we'll get an inside look into Oscars week by focusing on nominees from the Animation, Documentary and Live Action short film categories.

2.title: Hispanic Heritage Short Film Awards
2.plot: Join us for Festival Road Trip. The show following short filmmakers from their nomination to the closing ceremony in hopes of winning the top prize from iconic film festivals. For the first time ever, we're celebrating the Hispanic Heritage Short Film Awards to highlight the tremendous Latin talent within America.

imdb.title: Festival Road Trip
plot: Focusing on a selection of nominated short filmmakers with an inside look at the emotions and experiences of those individuals up for some of the short film industry's most prestigious awards.::Shorts International
